body_html:
@lebinhe
Please note: officially, we only support the following OS configurations:

Operating systems: Ubuntu Linux 14 LTE to 16. Mac OS X El Capitan. CentOS 7 and above

These messages are coming from the GRPC layer as it is trying to connect to other processes. With a large number of workers, I can imagine a number of things happening:

  1. Workers take a while to start and so connection requests are made before the other end is ready. I would hope that gRPC has a retry loop here, and perhaps the messages are benign (@mrry ?)
  2. Perhaps your OS has some firewall/anti-DDOS mechanism which is preventing large numbers of connections being established in a short time period? You would probably have to look at a packet level trace to see if this is happening.

If it is the first problem (namely an overly-verbose connection retry loop) then you may get lots of 'error messages', but eventually all the workers manage to get connected and training proceeds correctly. Is this what you meant by the following:?

All the workers are seemed to be connected to each other.

Or do the worker processes terminate after printing the error message?

@lebinhe
Please note: officially, we only support the following OS configurations:

Operating systems: Ubuntu Linux 14 LTE to 16. Mac OS X El Capitan. CentOS 7 and above

These messages are coming from the GRPC layer as it is trying to connect to other processes.  With a large number of workers, I can imagine a number of things happening:

Workers take a while to start and so connection requests are made before the other end is ready.  I would hope that gRPC has a retry loop here, and perhaps the messages are benign (@mrry ?)
Perhaps your OS has some firewall/anti-DDOS mechanism which is preventing large numbers of connections being established in a short time period?   You would probably have to look at a packet level trace to see if this is happening.

If it is the first problem (namely an overly-verbose connection retry loop) then you may get lots of 'error messages', but eventually all the workers manage to get connected and training proceeds correctly.  Is this what you meant by the following:?

All the workers are seemed to be connected to each other.

Or do the worker processes terminate after printing the error message?
body:
@lebinhe 
Please note: officially, we only support the following OS configurations:

> Operating systems: Ubuntu Linux 14 LTE to 16. Mac OS X El Capitan. CentOS 7 and above

These messages are coming from the GRPC layer as it is trying to connect to other processes.  With a large number of workers, I can imagine a number of things happening:
1) Workers take a while to start and so connection requests are made before the other end is ready.  I would hope that gRPC has a retry loop here, and perhaps the messages are benign (@mrry ?)
2) Perhaps your OS has some firewall/anti-DDOS mechanism which is preventing large numbers of connections being established in a short time period?   You would probably have to look at a packet level trace to see if this is happening.

If it is the first problem (namely an overly-verbose connection retry loop) then you may get lots of 'error messages', but eventually all the workers manage to get connected and training proceeds correctly.  Is this what you meant by the following:?

> All the workers are seemed to be connected to each other. 

Or do the worker processes terminate after printing the error message?
